DevOps Reading List

Many of these readings long pre-date the creation (in 2008) of the term DevOps. But the DevOps movement does not pretend to have sprung, like Athena, fully-formed from the head of Zeus. All of the leading DevOps figures explicitly acknowledge their great debt to the many brilliant figures who laid the foundations for what we today call DevOps, which consists in the merging of many earlier streams of thought on how to develop software and manage its deployment and operations.

  • A Pattern Language, Christopher Alexander
    Reviewers:
  • Antifragile, Nassim Nicholas Taleb
    Reviewers:
  • Continuous Delivery, Jez Humble and David Farley
    Reviewers: Sneha Ghosh, Ravish Bhatia
    Our review
  • DevOps Case Studies, The IT Revolution
    Reviewers:
  • Docker Up and Running, Karl Matthias and Sean P. Kane
    Reviewers:
  • Domain-Driven Design, Eric Evans
    Reviewers:
  • Effective DevOps, Jennifer Davis and Katherine Daniels
    Reviewers:
  • Implementing Lean Software Development, Mary and Tom Poppendieck, Jeff Sutherland, and Kent Beck
    Reviewers: Chaoqun Huang, Qiwei Zhou
  • Infrastructure as Code: Managing Servers in the Cloud, Kief Morris
    Reviewers: Adit Kumar, Shivraj
  • Just-in-Time for Today and Tomorrow, Taiichi Ohno and Setsuo Mito
    Reviewers:
  • Kubernetes Up and Running, Kelsey Hightower, Brendan Burns, and Joe Beda
    Reviewers: Sneha Ghosh, Ravish Bhatia
  • Leading the Transformation: Applying Agile and DevOps Principles at Scale, Gary Gruver and Tommy Mouser
    Reviewers:
  • Lean Software Development: An Agile Toolkit, Mary and Tom Poppendieck
    Reviewers: Jiawei Wang, Bowei Xu
    Our review
  • Making Work Visible, Dominica DeGrandis
    Reviewers: Akshay Hazare
    Our review
  • Manifesto for Agile Software Development, multiple authors
    Reviewers: Lili Xu, Yang Lou
    Our review
  • "No Silver Bullet," Fred Brooks
    Reviewers: Tingjun Zhang
    Our review
  • Phoenix Project, Gene Kim
    Reviewers: Garima Negi, Drumil Kaushik
  • Practical DevOps, Joakim Verona
    Reviewers: Pravar Singh, Kanishk Dugar
  • Release It!, Michael T. Nygard
    Reviewers:
  • Rugged DevOps, The Rugged Summit
    Reviewers: Arun Kuruvilla
  • Site Reliability Engineering, Betsy Beyer
    Reviewers:
  • Software Tools in Pascal, Brian Kernighan and P.J. Plauger
    Reviewers:
  • The Art of Monitoring, James Turnbull
    Reviewers: Tanya Jha
  • The DevOps Handbook, Gene Kim, Patrick Debois, John Willis, Jez Humble, and John Allspaw
    Reviewers: Janiel Atul Patel, Chiquita Ratnakar Prabhu
    Our review
  • The Machine That Changed the World, James Womack, Daniel Jones, and Daniel Roos
    Reviewers: Saniya Alekar, Anshal
  • The Mythical Man-Month, Fred Brooks
    Reviewers:
  • The Principles of Product Development Flow, Donald G. Reinersten
    Reviewers:
  • The Timeless Way of Building, Christopher Alexander
    Reviewers:
  • The UNIX Programming Environment, Brian Kernighan and Rob Pike
    Reviewers: Srinivas, Arun Kuruvilla
  • "The Use of Knowledge in Society," F.A. Hayek
    Reviewers: Linfeng Wang, Lingjung Zhang
    Our review
  • The Web Application Hacker's Handbook: Discovering and Exploiting Security Flaws
    Reviewers: Om Narayan
  • Toyota Production System: an Integrated Approach to Just-in-Time, Yasuhiro Monden
    Reviewers: Datta Dwarampudi
    Our review
  • Version Control with Git, John Loeliger and Matthew McCullough
    Reviewers:
